title: So the amount of money Riot makes is ridiculous right...
body:
Seeing that E-sport stat is absolutely insane to me.

> 25% of sales of Championship Zed and the 2016 Championship Ward Skin will be added to the Worlds Prize Pool.

Its already added over US$2 million.

25%

of a ward skin (640 - $6) and a 975 ($9.30) skin.

So Riot have made over $8 million on a $15 pair of items.

And Graves can't have a Cigar.

replies.body:
You were doing well, then you had to make the retarded "hurr graves no cigar".

It's a yes and no situation.
E-Sports actually makes very little money.
It's like when a band/singer puts on a concert, filling the hall will let you break even on renting out the stage, you make profit on merch sales.

E-Sports itself doesn't make profit, setting up that stage, all the promotional videos, the rent on the venues, all of that costs a LOT.
And where do you directly make money back on all that? Ticket sales.
Last I checked tickets are pretty cheap to LoL events.

When it comes down to it, the real profits for Riot come from skin sales, and not much else.
Skins are also really easy to sell.
People value their time, LoL is a game that you'll put a lot of time into, the more time you put into it the more likely you are to spend money on it.
Since LoL is currently the most popular game in the world, that is a lot of time that turns into skin sales.
